intro: Saurauia roemeri, commonly known as the alpine snowberry, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Saurauia roemeri thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its adaptability to cold climates and poor soils makes it a notable species in ecological studies of mountain ecosystems.
